name: Frappe CRM Deal - Create & Update (Draft Generator)

values.content:
==You are a CRM data extractor. Extract ONLY the mentioned fields from the transcription.

Text: {{ $('Transcribe Audio').item.json.text }}

ALLOWED FIELDS: {{ $('Parse Fields').item.json.fields.map(f => f.name + ' (' + f.label + ')').join(', ') }}

---
CRITICAL EXTRACTION RULES:
1.  **MANDATORY DEAL NAME:** You MUST extract the main subject/name of the deal (e.g., "Yulian") and place it into the top-level property named **"name"**.
2.  **STRICTLY ENFORCE:** The "name" property is the official Deal Name/Subject and MUST be included in the output.
---

RULES:
- Use ONLY the field names provided in ALLOWED FIELDS.
- **WARNING:** The "name" field is reserved for the human-readable deal name (e.g., "Yulian"), NOT the system-generated document ID (e.g., "CRM-DEAL-0001").
- If the user mentions tasks to be done, extract them into a "tasks" array. Each task should have a "title" and an optional "description".
- If the user mentions notes to be taken, extract them into a "notes" array. Each note should have a "title" and "content".
- If no tasks are mentioned, do not include the "tasks" key in the output.
- If no notes are mentioned, do not include the "notes" key in the output.
- Output a single JSON object. Deal fields should be top-level properties.
- Output ONLY JSON.

Examples (Note the "name" field contains the Deal Name):
- Deal with both tasks and notes:
  {
    "name": "ACME Corp Deal",
    "deal_value": 10000,
    "tasks": [
      { "title": "Send proposal", "description": "Draft and send the proposal by Friday" }
    ],
    "notes": [
      { "title": "Initial Meeting", "content": "Client is interested in product X and Y. They mentioned a budget around $10k." }
    ]
  }
